header.h1: Heritage Academy Board of Directs Statement on the COVID-19

p.span: Heritage Academy
March 14, 2020
Dear Heritage Academy Families,
We want to assure you that your child(ren)’s safety, health and academic growth are the top priorities of our school board, superintendent and staff members.

Novel Coronavirus, known as COVID-19 is causing great concern in our community, a concern that Heritage Academy is working to address daily. In response, we have been in regular communication with the
. We are also referring to guidance from the
l
(CDC) to base our planning to respond to the spread of COVID-19 on the most recent tracking of the disease and the latest science that has been reported on the disease.
At this time, the risk in Idaho is still very low. Our Board of Directors, in consultation with our Superintendent and staff members are taking the following initial steps to address concerns:

li.span: Parent teacher conferences (kindergarten-4th grade) will be held on Tuesday, March 17th instead of Wednesday, March 18th. Conference times are the same as those scheduled on Wednesday for each student. Parents may choose to attend conferences at school or by phone.
Middle school student-led conferences are cancelled. Parents may contact Mrs. Heil (Middle School Team Leader) or Ms. Higgins to schedule a phone conference.

School is cancelled, for students, on Wednesday March 18th and Thursday March 19th. This cancellation is to allow the staff time to develop a plan for potential long-term emergency closure. While we hope that a long-term closure will not be necessary, we will be reviewing current SDE and USDOE regarding technology-based instruction, services for students with disabilities, child nutrition services, along with any new recommendations regarding response to COVID-19.
We expect to resume school, as planned, on Monday March 30th. We will communicate any changes to that plan as quickly as possible.

p.span: We encourage you to follow the recommendations from the CDC to avoid the spread of all contagious illnesses.

a.span: What every American and community can do now to decrease the spread of the coronavirus

p.span: Please feel free to contact your child(ren)’s teacher(s) or Dr. Ivie with any questions or concerns.
Sincerely,
The Heritage Academy Board of Directors

ul.li: Please understand that Heritage Academy is making science-based decisions regarding school closure and COVID-19

Dr. Ivie is attending regular, often daily, conference calls with the Idaho Department of Education and Department of Health and Welfare regarding schools and COVID-19. These calls include very specific, current information from the Centers for Disease Control (CDC) regarding the situation in our state.

The upcoming closure (March 18th and 19th) is for the purpose of developing a long-term emergency closure plan, in the event that such a closure is necessary. In a very small school/district, our staff members wear multiple hats. This makes it difficult for all necessary staff members to meet and plan (because most teach during the day). In larger districts, with individuals serving as full-time program coordinators, planning can occur during the regular school day, while students are attending class.

The CDC, Governor’s Office and Idaho Department of Health and Welfare are urging schools to consider the following when making school closure decisions:
CDC School Closure Guidance
The risk to children is low (unless a child is immune compromised)
School closures have not been successful in limiting the spread of Coronavirus in other states and other countries
If schools close, there is a potential negative impact on students’ academic growth, access to school nutrition programs and access to school-based programs that assist students with a variety of challenges.
If schools close, there is a potential negative impact on access to adequate health care, as many health care professionals may need to stay home to care for children.

The Heritage Academy Board of Directors and staff members will meet as often as necessary to make decisions that are focused on our students’ and their families’ health, safety, academic success and well-being.

p.span: 14 de marzo de 2020
Queridas Familias de Heritage Academy,
Queremos asegurarle que la seguridad, la salud y el crecimiento académico de su(s) hijo/a(s) son las principales prioridades de nuestro consejo escolar, superintendente y miembros del personal.

Novel Coronavirus, conocido como COVID-19 está causando gran preocupación en nuestra comunidad, una preocupación que Heritage Academy está trabajando para abordar diariamente. En respuesta, hemos estado en comunicación regular con el

a.span: Departamento de Educación del Estado de Idaho (SDE),

p.span: Departamento de Educación de los
Hogar,
Distrito de Salud Pública central del sur/central.
También nos referimos a la orientación de los
Centros para el control de enfermedad
(CDC) para basar nuestra planificación para responder a la propagación de COVID-19 en el seguimiento más reciente de la enfermedad y la última ciencia que se ha divulgado sobre la enfermedad.

En este momento, el riesgo en Idaho sigue siendo muy bajo. Nuestra Junta Directiva, en consulta con nuestro Superintendente y los miembros del personal están tomando las siguientes medidas iniciales para abordar las preocupaciones:

li.span: Las conferencias de maestros y padres (kindergarten-4o grado) se llevarán a cabo el martes 17 de marzo en lugar del miércoles 18 de marzo. Los horarios de la conferencia son los mismos que los programados el miércoles para cada estudiante. Los padres pueden optar por asistir a conferencias en la escuela o por teléfono.

Las conferencias dirigidas por estudiantes de la escuela media 5º-8 se cancelan. Los padres pueden comunicarse con la Sra. Heil (Líder del Equipo de la Escuela Media) o con la Sra. Higgins para programar una conferencia telefónica.

La escuela se cancela, para los estudiantes, el miércoles 18 de marzo y el jueves 19 de marzo. Esta cancelación es para dar tiempo al personal para desarrollar un plan para el posible cierre de emergencia a largo plazo. Si bien esperamos que no sea necesario un cierre a largo plazo, revisaremos la SDE y la USDOE actuales con respecto a la instrucción basada en la tecnología, los servicios para estudiantes con discapacidades, los servicios de nutrición infantil, junto con las nuevas recomendaciones respuesta a COVID-19.
Esperamos reanudar la escuela, como estaba previsto, el lunes 30 de marzo. Comunicaremos cualquier cambio en ese plan lo más rápido posible.

p.span: Le recomendamos que siga las recomendaciones de los CDC para evitar la propagación de todas las enfermedades contagiosas.

a.span: Lo que todos los estadounidenses y la comunidad pueden hacer ahora para disminuir la propagación del coronavirus

p.span: Por favor, de ponerse en contacto con el(los) maestro(s) de su(s) hijo(s) o con el Dr. Ivie con cualquier pregunta o inquietud.
Sinceramente
La Junta Directiva de Heritage Academy
